Waterproofing: In a pinch, a handkerchief can be used to waterproof items such as bags or shoes. Simply wet the handkerchief and wrap it around the item, sealing it in place to prevent water from seeping through.

Bug repellent: A handkerchief can be used as a natural bug repellent by soaking it in a mixture of essential oils such as lavender, citronella, and tea tree oil. The scent of the oils can help deter insects such as mosquitoes and flies.
Fire starter: A handkerchief can be used as a fire starter by tearing it into small pieces and using it to ignite a fire. Simply hold the handkerchief to a spark and watch it catch fire.
Makeshift towel: In a pinch, a handkerchief can be used as a makeshift towel to dry off after a swim or to wipe away sweat. Simply fold it up and use it to dry your hands or face.

Emergency signaling: A handkerchief can be used as an emergency signaling device by tying it to a stick and using it to signal for help. The bright colors of the handkerchief can be easily seen from a distance, making it an effective way to attract attention.
